statements.name: PROC EEL
statements.description: Execute a set of rules against a data set, execute a single expression against a data set, and analyze a set of rules to determine the set of variables that are used in the rules.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the input data set. If an input data set is specified, the expression or rules are executed against each row in this data set. If not, the expression is executed once.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: specifies the output data set where results are written.

arguments.name: RULES=
arguments.description: specifies a data set containing rules. This data set must contain at a minimum these variables: rule_name - a unique identifier for the rule, and rule - the rule's expression.

arguments.name: UDFS=
arguments.description: specifies a data set that contains userâ€“defined functions. At a minimum, this argument should contain these variables: declaration - contains the name and type of the function; function - contains the expression.

arguments.name: INPUTKEY=
arguments.description: specifies a variable in the input data set that can act as a primary key for the input data.

arguments.name: PUSHSTATUS=
arguments.description: specifies a variable in the output data set that contains a value that indicates whether the row was created as a result of a pushrow() function call.

arguments.name: RETURNSTATUS=
arguments.description: specifies a variable in the output data set that contains a value that indicates whether the expression returned is true or false.

arguments.name: MAPPING
arguments.description: enables mapping variables in the input data set to expression variables.

arguments.name: STATIC
arguments.description: enables specifying static values for variables in the expression.

arguments.name: GROUPING
arguments.description: enables grouping of the input data set so that pre-group and post-group expressions can run.
